You said:
Now how can I deploy the website
ChatGPT said:

Great question! To deploy your EliahTulovemovies website so people can access it online (like on eliahtulovemovies.com), follow these steps:

Step 1: Choose a Hosting Platform

Here are beginner-friendly, powerful options:

Option 1: Vercel (Best for React apps)

  • Free & easy to use

  • Automatic deployments

  • Custom domain support

Option 2: Netlify (Also great for React)

  • Free tier, CI/CD

  • Easy domain connection

Option 3: Host on your own server (Advanced)

  • Use cPanel, DigitalOcean, or Firebase

  • More control, but setup is harder

Step 2: Deploy to Vercel (Recommended for You)

  1. Go to: https://vercel.com

  2. Sign in with GitHub or email

  3. Connect your GitHub repo or upload your project manually

  4. Click “Deploy”

  5. After deploy: Go to Settings → Domains to add your eliahtulovemovies.com domain

Step 3: Connect Your Domain

You already own eliahtulovemovies.com?

  • If yes, I’ll guide you to link it to Vercel

  • If no, buy it on Namecheap, GoDaddy, or Google Domains (I can help you pick the best one)

Want me to:

  • Help you deploy to Vercel now?

  • Or show you how to set up and connect your domain?

You said:
Help me and deploy it
ChatGPT said:

Perfect — I’ll help you deploy your EliahTulovemovies website on Vercel step-by-step. Here's what to do:

Step-by-Step: Deploy to Vercel

Step 1: Prepare Your Files

You already have the website code. You’ll need to:

  1. Create a folder called eliahtulovemovies

  2. Inside, place all your code — especially the index.js, package.json, public and src folders (if using React)

  3. Zip that folder (if you want to upload manually)

Step 2: Sign In to Vercel

  1. Go to https://vercel.com

  2. Click Sign in

  3. Use GitHub, GitLab, or email

  4. After login, click “+ New Project”

Step 3: Upload Your Website

You have two options:

Option A: GitHub (Best Option)

  1. Push your project to a GitHub repo

  2. On Vercel, choose “Import Git Repository”

  3. Select your repo and click “Deploy”

Option B: Manual Upload

  1. Click “Deploy a Project Manually”

  2. Upload the zipped folder of your site

  3. Vercel will auto-detect it’s a React app

  4. Click “Deploy”

Step 4: Get Your Live Link

  • After deployment, Vercel gives you a link like https://eliahtulovemovies.vercel.app

  • You can now share that with people or connect your domain

Want me to walk you through GitHub setup or manual upload right now?

Also: do you already have a GitHub account or want help setting it up?

Here’s what I need from your PayPal account:

    • Client ID

(If you’re testing first, use the Sandbox version instead.)

<div className="max-w-md mx-auto p-4">
<h2 className="text-lg font-semibold mb-2">Upload New Movie</h2>
<form onSubmit={handleUpload} className="space-y-2">
<input name="title" placeholder="Movie Title" className="w-full p-2 border rounded" required />
<input name="thumbnail" placeholder="Thumbnail URL" className="w-full p-2 border rounded" required />
<input name="video" placeholder="Video URL (mp4)" className="w-full p-2 border rounded" required />
<label className="flex items-center gap-2">
<input type="checkbox" name="premium" /> Premium Movie
</label>
<Button type="submit">Upload</Button>
</form>
</div>
)}

<div className="grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3 gap-4 p-4">
{movies.map((movie) => (
<Card key={movie.id} className="rounded-2xl shadow-lg">
<img src={movie.thumbnail} alt={movie.title} className="w-full h-48 object-cover rounded-t-2xl" />
<CardContent>
<h2 className="text-lg font-semibold mb-2">{movie.title}</h2>
{movie.premium && !paidMovies.includes(movie.id) ? (
<div className="space-y-2">
<div id={`paypal-button-container-${movie.id}`}></div>
{loadPayPalButton(movie.id)}
<Button className="w-full bg-yellow-500 hover:bg-yellow-600" onClick={() => alert("Coming soon: Mobile Money")}>Pay with Mobile Money</Button>
</div>
) : (
<div className="flex flex-col gap-2">
<Button onClick={() => setSelectedMovie(movie)}><PlayCircle className="mr-1" /> Play</Button>
<a href={movie.video} download>
<Button variant="secondary"><Download className="mr-1" /> Download</Button>
</a>
</div>
)}
</CardContent>
</Card>
))}
</div>
</>
) : (
<div className="p-4">
<Button onClick={() => setSelectedMovie(null)} className="mb-4">Back to Movies</Button>
<h2 className="text-xl font-bold mb-2">{selectedMovie.title}</h2>
<video
src={selectedMovie.video}
controls
className="w-full max-w-4xl mx-auto rounded-lg"
playbackRate={playbackSpeed}
></video>
<div className="mt-4 flex gap-2 flex-wrap">
{[0.5, 1, 1.5, 2].map((speed) => (
<Button
key={speed}
onClick={() => setPlaybackSpeed(speed)}
variant={speed === playbackSpeed ? "default" : "outline"}
>
{speed}x
</Button>
))}
</div>
</div>
)}

<div className="fixed bottom-4 right-4">
<a
href="https://api.whatsapp.com/send?phone=+256761787997&text=Movie%20requests"
target="_blank"
rel="noopener noreferrer"
>
<Button className="bg-green-500 hover:bg-green-600">WhatsApp</Button>
</a>
</div>
</div>
);
}
